resources.string:
Wel Come to Sumuhurtham

(Mantra)- Kala muhuthaah kashthaschahoratrascha sarvashaha/
Arthamasa masa ruthuvasamvastrascha kalpantam//

Time embodies God, as everyone proposes. Whatever work we plan to start has to be completed without any hurdles and its aim achieved. For this, everyone chooses good / auspicious time. All countries and all religions had have their own concepts of time. Many stories are popular in many countries where ancient civilizations flourished and whre there was an in-depth study of Astronomy. Our country, India had studied and researched deeply and made auspicious time known in the form of and through Astrology. Through this Astrology, we get good results. “When God is realized through time many great qualities are revealed through time”. These revelations are known as good / auspicious through time. A wink of an eye, a dream whole day, whole night, fortnight, a month, a half year and finally a year; these are parts of time.

The precise measurement of time has taken into consideration many things like kalpas, Swayambhuva manvantaras, yugas (ages) years ayanamsa (Six-month duration) months, sukla, krishna fortnights, weeks, day & nights and last but not the least it takes into account even a wink of an eye.

The book Muhurtha Darpanam discusses “Upanayana chapter”. It says…

(Slo)- Lagnesitah karmani Devapujyo bhavedravi sseetakara sshubhamse/
Hrudistha shastranyapi vardhayanti priyakshanenena yathendriyani//

The above “sloka” tells us that the wisdom as well as inner most quetiency of the child (Vatuvu) will explore, if we perform Upanayanam in the above mentioned time, the child (Vatuvu) will get extreme delight and well beingness which are similar to the ultimate happiness we get during the occasions like marriages, jatara,utsavams etc.

Therefore, let us perform good rituals in auspicious times and deserve to get precious wealth and comforts which are rendered to us by our Vedas and ancient sages.

Contact Us

You may contact us for ceremonies regarding Astrology, Auspicious Time (muhurtham), Vaasthu, Mental and physical welbeingness, Wealth growth, Family welfare, Acquiring servants, Acquisition of land, house, Education, Progeny, Mental broadening, Prevention from ill health, Getting married, Welbeingness of husband & wife, Life growth expectancy, Regarding assets of the ancestors, Employment, Business, Agricultural development, Income tax, Audit, Court business. Success in all fields and worthwhile journeys, etc.,

Auspicious ceremonies like marriage, Upanayana, house warming, sixty years completion-all will be done as per your wishes, Pujas, Japas, Parayanas, homam (rituals), Vrathas,Vigraha Pratishyha etc., will be done according to Shastras by the learned Vidwans and Pandits concerned. It is but natural to every human being bind over for the problems and the pros and cons in the world. But we have to recognize the above said fact and make a search for a correct solution. Most probably through religious ceremonies which were stated in our pious Vedas and the instructions given by our sages. In fact by virtue of those valuable narations in Vedas which have got supernatural powers there is every possibility to overcome the worldwide difficulties and detriments. Those who believe and willing that they could get solution for their problems through the above said vedakarmas they are advised to consult us

“Ghanaratna”
Gollapalli Venkatrama
SubrahmanyamGhanapati M.A,
S.V.V.S.Devasthanam, Vedapandit
Annavaram, Pin-533406.
EastGodavari Dist: AndhraPradesh, India.
Cell No. 9848641220.
Email: vedabhavangollapalli@gmail.com

About Us
All of us, due to good karma that has been done in our previous births, are leading a happy life. Our life is predestined. Everyone has an opportunity to lead a life by his own intuition. So we have to utilize this life and do all noble actions in auspicious times. Then only we will lead a life along the righteous path. A country will remain ever happy and peaceful if it upholds Dharma.

Being born in ancient traditional Sanatana Vedic family and having mastered ancient Vedas and knowledge, we have the benign blessings of the embodiment of Vedic learning and scholarship, “Brahmasri Uppuluri Ganapathi sastri”garu (Kakinada, Eg dt A.P.). Under his kind guidance we hold the pious view that “Shastram should be available to one and all”. As stated in the sloka,“Sarvakarmani Santyaktum na shakyam dehadharina” it is not possible for a human being to give up/forgo all action. Everyone should keep on doing ‘an action’. It is necessary that it should be done according to Shastras and in auspicious times. Then only we get happiness and comfort not only in this birth but also in the next births.

Why Us
Moksha (Liberation) means getting a state in which no sorrow / grief exists and a state from which we are not supposed to have birth again and again. To get this state of liberation, we should have knowledge about God. To get this spiritual knowledge we must possess God’s blessing and self centric concentration. To achieve all these ideal states, we have to get body, sense organ and mind purified. In order to purify them we have to do actions (karmas) and follow ancient Dharmas (principles of action) which have been mentioned in the Vedas. Based on Vedamantras (Vedic hymns) our sages Apastamba, Bodhayana had explained principles of shroutha, Grihya and dharma. They also said that a man’s life should be led as per the Vedas and as said above, he has to reach step by step in his life a liberated state; for this they have mentioned some actions, they are called Samskaras (Sacraments).

These samskaras are nothing but purpose oriented actions which are done through examining our mind and known by themselves.

These samskaras are self known actions and they follows: Garbhadhanam: Pumsavanam, Semanthonnayanam, Jaatakarma, Naamakaranam ( Christening ceremony), Annaprashana ( rice feeding, choulam ( ceremony of ear holing) upanayanam (instructing ceremony of divine-hymns), Vrathachatustayam (Four famous rituals), Godanam (cows offering ceremony), samavarthanam, vivaham (Marriage ceremony) of which for example. Garbhadhanam to chowlam samaskaras will have the effect of cleansing the impurities which originated in mother’s womb. Upanayanam & other samskaras will enable a person qualified for a knowledge of God.

(Slo)- Chitrakarma Yathanekairangai runmilyathe Sanaeh/
Brahmanyamapi thadvatsyat samskarairvidhi purvekaeh//

A sculptor who intends to make statue makes small dots on the paper/stones, connects these dots systematically to form the head, hands and other body parts and make them erect. Later he adorns it with jewels & dress. Then he smears different colors to its body parts in order to improve its beauty. After having done all these samskaras (actions) the sculpture / statue / picture gets beautiful shape and it causes happiness or delight to spectators. This law of making a sculpture is also applied, as sage Parashara said to ancient sages and learned men also reiterated that to have a knowledge of God, and to get (Brahmin hood) “Brahmanatvam” (that to know one self) we should realise that Samskaras will certainly be helpful to us.

To perform these aforesaid Samskaras, actions are in Vedas:- Vedas and Smruthis have mentioned some positions/ timings. For example, It is very favourable and auspicious to have a damsel married in Swathi nakshathra ( a star named swathi). This example is supported through a mantra ( a hymn) from Vedas.

(Hymn)- Yam kamayetha Duhitharam priyasyaDithi. Tannishtyayam Dadyat/
Priyaiva Bhavati. Nevathu punaragachati//

Father, who wishes his daughter to lead a life acceptable to her husband, has to perform her marriage on a day which coincides with Swathi nakshathra (a star named swathi faces over the time of marriage). If it is being done so, he or anyone needn’t worry about her future. The above example makes us know such an auspicious time we should know or have knowledge about good time completely.

It is said,”Jyouthishamayanamchakshuhu”, it means “Astrology is a vision to Vedas”. Without eyes nothing is seen. Everything appears dark. Astrology has three parts of which Muhurtha Prakaranam is one of the parts. In ”Muhurthaprakaranam”, some of the elements like Tithi, Vaaram, Nakshathram, Lagnam (subhamuhurtham) Grahayogam ( auspicious positions of planets) etc., that are necessary for a ritual are mentioned and explained. For example, Swathi nakshathra is very auspicious for a marriage but for house warming it is not auspicious. If we do so, even that house will go into another’s hand. In the same way, every muhurtha (auspicious time) has to have the forces of stars infrequency of moon and it should consist of Pamchakarahita. Every muhurtha should be without 21 Mahadoshas. A sloka says “Brahmavaa Parihartumatra sakalandoshan samarthonahee” it means “Not even Brahma is incapable of removing all the doshaas. Ancient sages (Rishis) opined that muhurthas which have more auspicious characteristics and less inauspicious traits must be followed.

The Fact is
When we fail to perform a good ritual on an appointed time which is set by learned men, that means we are not deserved to do it- It is the first reason.

Though we assume something is auspicious time, we are unable to perform a ritual in that time because it is against the science of time- it is the second reason.

Whenever you want to perform a ritual/karma all you need is your own experience, your experience in worldly things and knowledge in science.

We should perform every action/karma with complete readiness and we should take into consider place, time and circumstances. It should be done by unison of speech, mind and thought.

Before we set auspicious time we have to believe in planets and in science of portend/astrology. We should not be suspicious of the auspicious time we set and we have to perform that karma/ritual/action with utmost belief. It is better to have a small setback rather than having a deadly effect when we perform in an appointed time.

Example -: My friend’s sister marriage has been set on in a particular day. The marriage did not take place due to some reasons. Their relatives and family members felt very sorry. A few days later they came to know that the bridegroom’s character is not up to the mark. Now they are very happy. Learned men are bound to set the muhurtham and we are mere performers of doing. Later good results or ill-effects of it are in the control of god.

One day a certain king had his finger cut while he was eating fruits by accidentally.

His minister, who stands near him, said that’’ it was good to happen”. The king became angry by his words and he wanted to teach his minister a lesson. The next day they went to forest for hunting and the king suddenly pushed his minister into a well and said sarcastically” all is well that happened to us” and he moved away from there by leaving his minister alone. While he was returning to his kingdom a certain tribe of the forest had kidnapped and decided to sacrifice to goddess kali. Meanwhile they observed one of his finger cut so released him. The king suddenly remembered the words uttered by his minister when he had his finger cut. He went for his minister and taken him out of the well. He then asked his minister “it helped me having cut my finger but how did it help you being thrown into a well?” The minister said” if you did not push me into the well, I would be with you and I would have been sacrificed by them instead of you . “That’s why everyone should assume “all is well that happened to us”

So we should think that whatever happened to us that is happened for our best. But, we never doubtful of the muhurtham (auspicious time) and the science of portend. If we did doubt it ill effects arise out of it.

Every being (jeevatma) is eternal. With it, its grief is eternal. To remove, a little speck of its grief, our holymen, who are kind and benevolent of mankind, revealed this science of portend (muhurtha sastram).

Swasti
Swasthi prajabhyaha paripaalayamtam
Nyayyena maargena maheem mahisaaha
Gobrahmanebhya sshubhamasthu nityam
Lokaa ssamasta ssukhinoo bhavantu
Kaalee varsha thu parjanyaha pruthivi sasyashalini
Deeshoyam kshobharahitho brahmanaassanthu nirbhayaaha
Aputraha putrina ssantu putrina ssantu pautrinaha
Adhanaa ssadhanaa ssantu jeevantu shaaradaam shatham
Om Shaanti : Shaanti : Shaanti :

resources.string: This muhurtham (auspicious time) is available to me because of my well doings in my past births and it is my responsibility for the pros and cons of the muhurthams set by me.
